question: When does the semester start and end?
answer:
Academic calendar varies by intake:
- May Intake: May-August (Semester 1), September-December (Semester 2)
- October Intake: October-January (Semester 1), February-May (Semester 2)

Add these dates to Google Calendar:
- [May Intake Semester 1](https://calendar.google.com/calendar/r/eventedit?text=May+Intake+Semester+1&dates=20250501T080000/20250831T170000)
- [May Intake Semester 2](https://calendar.google.com/calendar/r/eventedit?text=May+Intake+Semester+2&dates=20250901T080000/20251231T170000)
- [October Intake Semester 1](https://calendar.google.com/calendar/r/eventedit?text=October+Intake+Semester+1&dates=20251001T080000/20260131T170000)
- [October Intake Semester 2](https://calendar.google.com/calendar/r/eventedit?text=October+Intake+Semester+2&dates=20260201T080000/20260531T170000)

question: When are the examination periods?
answer:
Final examinations are typically held in the last 2 weeks of each semester.

- [May Intake Exams](https://calendar.google.com/calendar/r/eventedit?text=May+Intake+Exams&dates=20250818T080000/20250831T170000)

question: What are the public holidays observed by the university?
answer:
TAR UMT follows Malaysian public holidays. Academic calendar is updated annually on the student portal.
You can also subscribe to [Malaysian Public Holidays Calendar](https://calendar.google.com/calendar/u/0?cid=en.malaysian%23holiday%40group.v.calendar.google.com) for reminders.

question: When is the mid-semester break?
answer:
Mid-semester breaks are usually 1 week long, scheduled in the middle of each semester.
Add to Google Calendar:
- [May Intake Mid-Semester Break](https://calendar.google.com/calendar/r/eventedit?text=May+Intake+Mid-Semester+Break&dates=20250715T080000/20250721T170000)
- [October Intake Mid-Semester Break](https://calendar.google.com/calendar/r/eventedit?text=October+Intake+Mid-Semester+Break&dates=20251215T080000/20251221T170000)

question: How many semesters are there in a year?
answer: There are 2 main semesters per year, with an optional short semester during semester breaks.
